Title: Troops nab wanted terrorists’ collaborators – DHQ
Summary: Troops in conjunction with hybrid forces and other security agencies have sustained offensive operations in all theatres to provide safe corridors for farming activities . This is contained in a statement by the Director, Defence Headquarters .

Title: Zulum bans tree felling, declares sanitation day in Borno
Summary: Gov. Babagana Zulum of Borno has signed two executive orders banning indiscriminate tree felling and mandating a monthly, statewide, environmental sanitation exercise . The orders were signed on Saturday at the Government House in Maiduguri .

Title: Guinness presents EPL Trophy to Enugu fans
Summary: Guinness Nigeria PLC has said it’s partnership with the Premier League has boosted sports globally . Corporate Relations Director, Rotimi Odusola, led a team of Guinness Nigeria's management to showcase the English Premier League trophy .

Title: Group urges South-South leaders to intervene in Akpabio, Akpoti-Uduaghan rift
Summary: Group urges South-South leaders to intervene in Akpabio, Akpoti-Uduaghan rift . Nigeria Ethnic Nationalities Youth Leaders Council Worldwide (NENYLCW) called for intervention . The group expressed concern over the prolonged controversy .

Title: Cross River promises medal haul at sports festival
Summary: Cross River State promises to put up a strong showing at the 22nd National Sports Festival . The festival is scheduled to take place from the 16th to 30th of May, 2025, in Abeokuta, the Ogun State capital . The state Director of Sports, Mr Ita Moses, says Cross River will put up strong showing

Title: Pope Leo’s inauguration: Group faults Vatican’s invitation to Tinubu
Summary: The International Society for Civil Liberties and Rule of Law, Intersociety, faulted the invitation extended to President Bola Tinubu by the Vatican for the inauguration of Pope Leo XIV . The group alleged that over 15,640 people, mostly Christians, were killed and 14,600 abducted by bandits under the invitation .

Title: Tinubu arrives in Rome for Pope Leo XIV’s inauguration
Summary: President Tinubu's flight landed at the Military Airport in Rome at about 5 a.m. local time on Saturday . President Tinuba's flight arrived at the military Airport at around 5a.m, local time .

Title: FG denies report of plan to reintegrate BEA scholars
Summary: Federal Ministry of Education denies report of plan to reintegrate BEA scholars into Nigerian universities . The BEA Programme was cancelled following the cancellation of the BEA programme . The federal government insisted contrary to the report, contrary to its Director, Press and Public Relations .

Title: 13,000 teachers write professional qualifying exam
Summary: 13,000 teachers across the country yesterday wrote the May edition of the Teachers’ Professional Qualifying Examination, PQE . The Acting Registrar of TRCN, Stella Maria Nwokeocha, disclosed this while monitoring the exercise .

Title: Wike pledges to extend bus terminals to Bwari, Gwagwalada
Summary: Minister of the Federal Capital Territory FCT, Nyesom Wike promised to build bus terminals in Bwari and Gwagwalada Area Councils . The .minister disclose this on Saturday in Abuja after inspecting the area .

Title: Wike dismisses 2027 presidential bid rumours, pledges loyalty to Tinubu
Summary: Rumour has it that if the Peoples Democratic Party agrees to zone its presidential ticket to the South, Nyesom Wike may join the race . Former Rivers State governor said he cannot contest against his boss . Wike said there is nobody in the opposition to challenge the President .

Title: Abia honours ex-corps member with award, cash prize for community impact
Summary: The Abia Government, on Saturday, conferred the Outstanding Corps Member of the Year 2024 Award on Francis Owums for his immense contributions to the socio-economic development of the state . The ex-corps member was honoured with the State Honours Award during a colourful ceremony at the National Youth Service Corps Secretariat in Umuah

Title: Rivers crisis: Fubara remains my political son despite rift — Wike
Summary: The Minister of the Federal Capital Territory, Nyesom Wike, has described the suspended Governor of Rivers State, Siminalayi Fubara, as his political son despite their rift . In an interview with BBC Pidgin published on Saturday, Wike said he cannot fight his son, refuting claims of a feud .

Title: Adeleke orders review of 'shoddy' road project after community protest
Summary: Residents of Aduramigba community had earlier held a peaceful protest over the quality of work done on the 4.76 kilometres road that passes through the area . Residents carried placards with inscriptions such as ‘We say no to no drainage and stone base road’, ‘Don’t cause quick pain for

Title: Kwankwaso disowns viral statement, calls it 'political mischief'
Summary: The presidential candidate of the New Nigeria Peoples Party in the 2023 general elections, Senator Rabiu Kwankwaso, has disowned a statement circulating on social media, which allegedly claimed to represent his views on Nigeria’s ongoing political realignments . The former Kano State governor and influential political figure further stated that he has
